Description: Egyptian terracotta female figure wearing festival wreath headdress. Mould-made. Head only. Dark red-brown Nile silt fabric with abundant fine gold mica, quartz and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Similar 1st century BC (Bayer-Niemeier 1988: Pl.2.9 no.15) and late 3rd century BC parallels (Török 1995: Pl.116, nos.216 and 217) and an example from Memphis (Petrie 1909: Pl.XXXI.105-6). See also similar examples NA527, NA530 and NA536 from Naukratis (less so NA529 and NA532). Good parallel from Athribis (Tell Atrib) dated to the late 3rd or early 2nd century BC (Szmańska 2005, no.201). Mid to late 3rd century BC parallel from Alexandria (Tezgör 2007, no. 216, see also 83). Bayer Niemeier, E. 1988. ‘Liebieghaus Museum Alter Plastik. Bildwerke der Sammlung Kaufmann, 1. Griechisch-römische Terrakotten’. Melsungen. Szymańska, H. 2005, Terres cuites d’Athribis, Turnhout. Török, L. 1995. ‘Hellenistic and Roman terracottas from Egypt’. Roma. Petrie, W.M.F. 1909. The palace of Apries. Memphis volume I. London: School of Archaeology in Egypt. Tezgör, D. K. 2007. Tanagréennes d'Alexandrie : figurines de terre cuite hellénistiques des nécropoles orientales. Musée gréco-romain d'Alexandrie. Études alexandrines 13. Cairo : Institut Français d'Archéologie Orientale.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.417) (Phase 1)
Gutch 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis, D. The Terracottas (p. 84, nos 94-123)
